items.title: Scientists just found a molecule that could stop Parkinson’s in its tracks
bullets: • Researchers have designed a peptide that prevents the deadly misfolding of alpha-synuclein, the protein behind Parkinson’s and some dementias
• In lab and animal tests, it stabilized the protein and improved motor function
• The work demonstrates the power of rational drug design in tackling brain diseases that have long lacked effective treatments

items.title: Glacier melt will lead to ice-free peaks in California for first time in human history
bullets: • California's Sierra Nevada glaciers are projected to melt away completely by the beginning of the next century
• The mountain range’s glaciers are older than previously known, with some as old as the last ice age
• A future glacier-free Sierra Nevada is unprecedented in human history since known peopling of the Americas, researchers say

items.title: Bacteria hidden inside tumors could help beat cancer

• The molecule, called 2-methylisocitrate (2-MiCit), was found to make colorectal cancer cells more vulnerable to chemotherapy by damaging their DNA and disrupting their metabolism

items.title: Physicists just built a quantum lie detector. It works
bullets: • Physicists from Leiden, Beijing en Hangzhou and Tsinghua University in China prove large quantum systems really do obey quantum mechanics
• Using Bell’s test across 73 qubits, they proved the presence of genuine quantum correlations that can’t be explained classically
• Results show quantum computers are not just bigger, but more authentically quantum

items.title: From problem to possibility: how your attention can improve your life

• In a world of constant digital noise, by reclaiming our attention we can improve our lives

items.title: Timex is resurrecting its first LCD watch 50 years later
bullets: • In 1972, Hamilton’s Pulsar Time Computer launched the first commercially sold digital watch, but its LED screen was power hungry and only showed the time when you pushed a button
• Now, 50 years later, Timex is resurrecting that breakthrough watch
• The Timex SSQ Digital Reissue has been updated with a recycled stainless-steel case and a chunky but retro-looking navy blue acrylic bezel around the LCD display

items.title: This $299 Rubik’s Cube swaps colored squares for LCD screens
bullets: • The Rubik’s WOWCube is a 2x2 version of the puzzle that trades colored squares for 24 tiny LCD displays
• It still rotates like a traditional Rubik's Cube, but instead of aligning colored squares those mechanics are used to play mobile games like 2048 and Space Invaders
• The device is now available for preorder for a steep $299
